active_learning.peer_teaching: In pairs, one student explains the differences between SCCs and BCRs under GDPR (including use cases and EDPB recommendations), while the other creates and teaches back a simple diagram. Switch roles and discuss applicability to non-EU frameworks like APEC CBPR.
active_learning.problem_solving: For a fictional multinational e-commerce company expanding from the US to EU and Asia: Map data flows (e.g., customer data to cloud servers), identify compliance gaps (GDPR TIA, PIPL localization), and propose documentation solutions. Think-pair-share misconceptions like 'All countries have equivalent protections.'

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Asset Security. Topic: Cross-Border Data Flow Documentation (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Asset Security > Data Security Controls > Data Flow and Transfer Controls > Data Flow Mapping and Documentation > Cross-Border Data Flow Documentation). Incorporate this full research context: Cross-border data flows involve personal/sensitive data movement across jurisdictions via cloud, transactions, etc. Key terms: data privacy/protection, asset security, governance, localization. Frameworks: GDPR (adequacy decisions, SCCs for controllers/processors, BCRs for intra-group, TIA per EDPB Guidelines 05/2021 post-Schrems II requiring supplementary measures like encryption); CCPA (California consumer opt-out for sales); PIPL (China: localization for critical data, security assessments for exports); LGPD (Brazil: adequacy-like for some); APEC CBPR (voluntary cross-border rules). Best practices: Map flows, assess risks, document with diagrams/audit trails, use tools like DLP. Sources: edpb.europa.eu (Guidelines 05/2021), gdpr.eu, iapp.org, cnil.fr/pIPL.
